entries.name: LIBYAML_VERSION
entries.desc: The version of libyaml Psych is using

entries.name: VERSION
entries.desc: The version of Psych you are using

entries.name: dump(o)               → string of yamlclick to toggle source
dump_stream(*objects)
entries.desc: Dump a list of objects as separate documents to a document stream.

entries.name: libyaml_versionclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns the version of libyaml being used

entries.name: load(yaml, legacy_filename = NOT_GIVEN, filename: nil, fallback: false, symbolize_names: false)
entries.desc: Load yaml in to a Ruby data structure.  If multiple documents are provided, the object contained in the first document will be returned. filename will be used in the exception message if any exception is raised while parsing.  If yaml is empty, it returns the specified fallback return value, which defaults to false.

entries.name: load_file(filename, fallback: false)
entries.desc: Load the document contained in filename.  Returns the yaml contained in filename as a Ruby object, or if the file is empty, it returns the specified fallback return value, which defaults to false.

entries.name: load_stream(yaml, legacy_filename = NOT_GIVEN, filename: nil, fallback: [])
entries.desc: Load multiple documents given in yaml.  Returns the parsed documents as a list.  If a block is given, each document will be converted to Ruby and passed to the block during parsing

entries.name: parse(yaml, legacy_filename = NOT_GIVEN, filename: nil, fallback: NOT_GIVEN)
entries.desc: Parse a YAML string in yaml.  Returns the Psych::Nodes::Document. filename is used in the exception message if a Psych::SyntaxError is raised.

entries.name: parse_file(filename, fallback: false)
entries.desc: Parse a file at filename. Returns the Psych::Nodes::Document.

entries.name: parse_stream(yaml, legacy_filename = NOT_GIVEN, filename: nil, &block)
entries.desc: Parse a YAML string in yaml.  Returns the Psych::Nodes::Stream. This method can handle multiple YAML documents contained in yaml. filename is used in the exception message if a Psych::SyntaxError is raised.

entries.name: safe_load(yaml, legacy_permitted_classes = NOT_GIVEN, legacy_permitted_symbols = NOT_GIVEN, legacy_aliases = NOT_GIVEN, legacy_filename = NOT_GIVEN, permitted_classes: [], permitted_symbols: [], aliases: false, filename: nil, fallback: nil, symbolize_names: false)
entries.desc: Safely load the yaml string in yaml.  By default, only the following classes are allowed to be deserialized:

entries.name: to_json(object)
entries.desc: Dump Ruby object to a JSON string.
